intro: Senecio kaschkarowi, commonly known as the Karakoram groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Karakoram Mountains in Pakistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh mountain climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Senecio kaschkarowi is valued for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
